article.headline: LSU 66, Centenary 63
article.story: SHREVEPORT, La. (AP) -- Antonio Hudson scored 22 points as LSU defeated Centenary 66-63 Saturday night for coach John Brady's 200th career victory. Jaime Lloreda added 18 points for the Tigers (9-1) and Brandon Bass had 10. "We were fortunate to win the game. I give all the credit to Centenary because they outplayed us and outhustled us for loose balls. However, I'll take any win we can get," LSU head coach John Brady said. Andrew Wisniewski led Centenary (6-5) with 21 points and five rebounds, while Chad Maclies added 12 and five rebounds. Michael Gale had 11 points. The Gents got the jump on the Tigers, going up by as much as 11 points at 30-19 with 4:24 remaining in the first half. But LSU went on a 12-4 run at the end of the first half to cut the lead to three at 34-31 at halftime. Centenary head coach Kevin Johnson said he was pleased with how close his team stayed to LSU. "I think that's a credit to our guys. Andrew Wisniewski, Rickey Evans, and Ronald Mickel are examples of senior who are warriors. There is no quit to these guys," he said. The Gents scored four points in the first minute of the second half to go up by seven, but the Tigers slowly chipped away at the lead. LSU took its first lead of the game at 44-42 on an Antonio Hudson 3-pointer and held off Centenary throughout the rest of the half. Centenary managed to tie it up with 4:45 left to play, but a jumper by Lloreda finished off the Gents.
